com.vaadin.server.sessionstorage
Interface SessionStorage

All Superinterfaces:
java.io.Serializable
All Known Implementing Classes:
AmazonS3SessionStorage, HTML5LocalStorageSessionStorage
public interface SessionStorage
extends java.io.Serializable

The SessionStorage interface is used in the PersistenceStorageService and is the interface that enables storing VaadinSession objects to storage medias (like for instance Amazon S3 service).

Author:
mrosin

Method Summary
 VaadinSession loadSession(VaadinRequest request)
          The loadSession method that is called when a session is to be fetched from a storage media.
 void storeSession(VaadinSession vaadinSession, int uiId, java.lang.String Identifier, VaadinRequest request)
          The storeSession method is called when a session should be stored into a storage media.
 

Method Detail

loadSession

VaadinSession loadSession(VaadinRequest request)
The loadSession method that is called when a session is to be fetched from a storage media.

Parameters:
request - The VaadinRequest that was associated with the call from the service. Contains all the request information
Returns:
The VaadinSession or null if none was found

storeSession

void storeSession(VaadinSession vaadinSession,
                  int uiId,
                  java.lang.String Identifier,
                  VaadinRequest request)
The storeSession method is called when a session should be stored into a storage media.

Parameters:
vaadinSession - The VaadinSession object to store
uiId - The UI objects id that from which a request was made
Identifier - The identifier that identifies the client and to which the Session will be mapped to in the storage media.
request - The VaadinRequest that was associated with the call from the service. Contains all the request information
